Generation I.Red: Long considered a mythical Pok é mon until recently when a small colony was found living underwater.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: Long considered a mythical Pok é mon until recently when a small colony was found living underwater.
Generation I.Yellow: The existence of this mythical Pok é mon was only recently confirmed by a fisherman who caught one.
Generation I.Stadium: Even the young are known to exceed 6' 6" . It is rare and was long considered to exist only in myth.

Generation II.Gold: It is born large to start with. It repeatedly sheds its skin as it steadily grows longer.
Generation II.Silver: This Pok é mon is full of life energy. It continually sheds its skin and grows steadily larger.
Generation II.Crystal: It sheds many layers of skin as it grows larger. During this process, it is protected by a rapid waterfall.
Generation II.Stadium 2: It is born large to start with. It repeatedly sheds its skin as it steadily grows longer. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) This Pok é mon is full of life energy. It continually sheds its skin and grows steadily larger. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Dratini continually molts and sloughs off its old skin. It does so because the life energy within its body steadily builds to reach uncontrollable levels.
Generation III.Sapphire: Dratini continually molts and sloughs off its old skin. It does so because the life energy within its body steadily builds to reach uncontrollable levels.
Generation III.Emerald: A Dratini continually molts and sloughs off its old skin. It does so because the life energy within its body steadily builds to reach uncontrollable levels.
Generation III.FireRed: Even the young can exceed 6.5 feet in length. It grows larger by repeatedly shedding skin.
Generation III.LeafGreen: Long considered a mythical Pok é mon until recently, when a small colony was found living underwater.

Generation IV.Diamond: It is called the "Mirage Pokémon" because so few have seen it. Its shed skin has been found.
Generation IV.Pearl: It is called the "Mirage Pokémon" because so few have seen it. Its shed skin has been found.
Generation IV.Platinum: It is called the "Mirage Pokémon" because so few have seen it. Its shed skin has been found.
Generation IV.HeartGold: It is born large to start with. It repeatedly sheds its skin as it steadily grows longer.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: This Pokémon is full of life energy. It continually sheds its skin and grows steadily larger.

Generation V.Black: It is called the "Mirage Pokémon" because so few have seen it. Its shed skin has been found.
Generation V.White: It is called the "Mirage Pokémon" because so few have seen it. Its shed skin has been found.
Generation V.Black 2: It is called the "Mirage Pokémon" because so few have seen it. Its shed skin has been found.
Generation V.White 2: It is called the "Mirage Pokémon" because so few have seen it. Its shed skin has been found.

Generation VI.X: It is called the "Mirage Pokémon" because so few have seen it. Its shed skin has been found.
Generation VI.Y: This Pokémon is full of life energy. It continually sheds its skin and grows steadily larger.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Dratini continually molts and sloughs off its old skin. It does so because the life energy within its body steadily builds to reach uncontrollable levels.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Dratini continually molts and sloughs off its old skin. It does so because the life energy within its body steadily builds to reach uncontrollable levels.

Generation VII.Sun: It grows by molting repeatedly. Boots made from the tanned cast-off skin are a super luxury item.
Generation VII.Moon: After a 10-hour struggle, a fisherman was able to pull one up and confirm its existence.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: It's still weak, so it lurks on the floor of bodies of water, eating whatever food sinks down and living a quiet life.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: It sheds its skin—almost on a daily basis—and grows larger. Its skin is soft just after it's been shed.
Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: Long thought to be a myth, this Pokémon's existence was only recently confirmed by a fisherman who caught one.
Generation VII.Let's Go Eevee: Long thought to be a myth, this Pokémon's existence was only recently confirmed by a fisherman who caught one.

Generation VIII.Sword: Dratini dwells near bodies of rapidly flowing water, such as the plunge pools of waterfalls. As it grows, Dratini will shed its skin many times.
Generation VIII.Shield: This Pokémon was long considered to be no more than a myth. The small lump on a Dratini's forehead is actually a horn that's still coming in.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It is called the Mirage Pokémon because so few have seen it, but its shed skin has been found.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: It is called the Mirage Pokémon because so few have seen it, but its shed skin has been found.

Generation IX.Scarlet: It sheds many layers of skin as it grows larger. During this process, it is protected by a rapid waterfall.
Generation IX.Violet: It is born large to start with. It repeatedly sheds its skin as it steadily grows longer.
